greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: (Sum of the squares of the quadratic nonresidues of prime(n)) / prime(n).
reference: D. M. Burton, Elementary Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, Sixth Edition (2007), p. 185.
link: N. Hobson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..1000
N. Hobson, Home page (listed in lieu of email address)
example: The quadratic nonresidues of 7=prime(4) are 3, 5 and 6. Hence a(4) = (3^2 + 5^2 + 6^2)/7 = 10.
results.author: Nick Hobson, Nov 30 2006
